title.narrative: PP15 Lukop Elementary School Renovation Project

description.narrative: This award strives to generate rapid, sustained, and broad-based economic growth. More specifically, this includes a The Lukop Elementary School serves a population of over 1500 with an average of 202 students enrolled and is an important rural 'feeder' school to the Secondary school in Kolonia. The facility lacks funding for urgently needed maintenance and scheduled up-keep and is deteriorating due to extreme tropical climate and proximity to the corrosive ocean air. The facility's condition is run-down, the roof leaks, it's non-conducive to education or safety and the prolonged lack of maintenance could soon result in structural damage. This project will return the facility to a serviceable condition by medium scale renovation and maintenance actions. This project will be completed by US Navy Seabees, School Staff and Local Volunteers as a way to preserve the School facility, improve delivery of classes and demonstrate the importance of capitol reinvestment and doing regular maintenance. Project cost includes 10% contingency in addition to direct material costs..
To generate rapid, sustained, and broad-based economic growth.

description.narrative: Spread over a million square miles of ocean on 607 islands and with over half of the population and supporting infrastructure located in low-lying coastal areas, the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM) is highly vulnerable to natural disasters, including typhoons, landslides, drought, and storm surges (waves). As required under P.L. 108-188, the Compact of Free Association Act of 2003, USAID coordinates and implements disaster relief and reconstruction assistance in the FSM. To protect public health and safety, U.S. assistance increases the FSM's capacity to quickly respond to and manage disasters.
